channel.title: Upgrade from 13 to 14 breaking Whonix every time
channel.description:
Hi!
Following instructions from: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Upgrading_Whonix_13_to_Whonix_14
I'm not able to upgrade existing Whonix v13 installation.
Everything brakes on: `apt-get-noninteractive dist-upgrade`
when packages are downloaded and unpacked, and after that: `dpkg: error: dpkg status database is locked by another processE: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)`
Meanwhile AppArmour is spitting errors on desktop notifications every second: AppArmour Message Profile: /usr/bin/whonixcheck Operation: exec Name: /sbin/getcap Denied: x Logfile /var/log/kern.log
I can't simply remove lock on dpkg becouse AppArmour will lock it again instantly.
This is happening on v13 Workstation on my own images and on freshly installed ones from .ova files (clean, updated, without any modification made).
Any suggestions?

item.title: Upgrade from 13 to 14 breaking Whonix every time
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
sudo systemctl stop whonixcheck
sudo killall whonixcheck
sudo dpkg --configure -a

Read full topic
item.source: Upgrade from 13 to 14 breaking Whonix every time

item.title: Upgrade from 13 to 14 breaking Whonix every time
item.dc:creator: Harlem
item.description:
Hi!

Following instructions from:

Whonix

Upgrading Whonix 13 to Whonix 14

How to Upgrade from Whonix 13.x to Whonix 14.x

I’m not able to upgrade existing Whonix v13 installation.

Everything brakes on:
apt-get-noninteractive dist-upgrade

when packages are downloaded and unpacked, and after that:
dpkg: error: dpkg status database is locked by another processE: Sub-process /usr/bin/dpkg returned an error code (2)

Meanwhile AppArmour is spitting errors on desktop notifications every second:
AppArmour Message
Profile: /usr/bin/whonixcheck
Operation: exec Name: /sbin/getcap
Denied: x Logfile /var/log/kern.log

I can’t simply remove lock on dpkg becouse AppArmour will lock it again instantly.

This is happening on v13 Workstation on my own images and on freshly installed ones from .ova files (clean, updated, without any modification made).

Any suggestions?

Read full topic
item.source: Upgrade from 13 to 14 breaking Whonix every time
